ARABIC: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كِسْفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا۟ سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If they saw a lump of heaven falling down, they would just say, 'Banked-up clouds!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If they should see a segment falling from the sky, they would say: "It is only a massive cloud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (So obstinate are they that) even if they were to see some fragments of the sky falling down they would still say: “It is only a mass of cloud.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Even if they were to see a part of the heavens falling down upon them, they would say, "It is only dense cloud".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And were they to see a portion of the sky falling, they will say, “It is a heap of clouds.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if they should see a portion of the heaven coming down, they would say: Piled up clouds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Even if they saw lumps falling from heaven, they would say, 'A massed cloud!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If they should see a part of the heavens falling down, they would say, "A mass of clouds,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if they should see a fragment of the heaven falling down, they would say: it is only clouds piled up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Were they to see a fragment falling from the sky, they would say, ‘A cumulous cloud.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would (only) say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if they were to see a piece of the heaven falling down, they would say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Even if they saw lumps falling from the sky they would say: 'A massed cloud'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Even if they were to see lumps of the sky falling down, they would say, “A mass of clouds.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:44] And if they were to see a fragment, a portion, of the heaven falling, on them — as they say, Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us [Q. 26:187], as a chastisement for them — they would say, this is: ‘A heap of clouds!’, piled on top of one another, that will bring us water; and so they do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if they) the disbelievers of Mecca (were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A 619 heap of clouds) because of their denial.
